thread.title: Poll: SNP have 30% lead over Labour in Holyrood 2016 elections
thread.title_full: Poll: SNP have 30% lead over Labour in Holyrood 2016 elections (From Herald Scotland)

author: Jill Castle
title: Poll: SNP have 30% lead over Labour in Holyrood 2016 elections
text:
The SNP have a 30% lead over Labour ahead of the 2016 Holyrood election, according to a new poll.
A YouGov poll for The Times shows the SNP are currently ahead of Labour with 51% of the vote, while Labour trail behind with 21%.
The Conservatives are set to take 19% of the vote, while the Liberal Democrats are expected to secure 5%.
#SNP15 gets off to a flying start in #Aberdeen - @yougov poll gives 30% lead for @theSNP in #SP16 pic.twitter.com/yfKHsmjFG9
— The SNP (@theSNP) October 15, 2015 Breaking @YouGov @thetimes Poll shows 30% lead for SNP for #SP16 : SNP 51 (=) LAB 21 (-1) CON 19 (+1) LDEM 5 (+1) #SNP15 #KeepTheHeid
— Humza Yousaf (@HumzaYousaf) October 15, 2015 The SNP, who won 56 seats in the Westminster 2015 election, launched their party conference in Aberdeen today.
SNP's 81st annual national conference starts today. Join the conversation at #SNP15
Share article — The SNP (@theSNP) October 15, 2015 The poll was carried out between October 9 and 13 2015 by YouGov for The Times.
